alert.note: Alert for Erie; Genesee; Niagara; Wyoming (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 23 at 4:57PM EST until February 24 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in New York... Tonawanda Creek At Batavia affecting Wyoming, Erie, Niagara and Genesee Counties. .Rain and snowmelt led to rising levels on creeks and rivers. Flows in rivers will increase quickly and reach critical levels. For the Tonawanda Creek...including Attica, Batavia, Rapids... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tonawanda Creek At Batavia. * WHEN...From this afternoon to early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Moderate flood, flooding along West Main Street and South Main Street in Batavia and along the creek from Batavia to East Pembroke, extending to the Tonawanda Indian Reservation. Flooding will mainly impact roads, with some residential and commercial flooding possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:00 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 9.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:00 PM EST Wednesday was 9.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.3 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.3 feet on 02/19/2022. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 500 AM EST.
